Has the topic of supporting wildcards in layout paths ever come up? Not % placeholders; true wildcards, so that, for example, a layout with path foo* would be used for both /foospam and /fooeggs. Particularly if implemented along with issue 3749, Make layouts aware of path aliases, this seems like it would be really useful. One could create a layout with path *, then use visibility conditions in "Menu settings" to apply it to all sorts of diverse paths selectively.

[UX] Make layouts aware of path aliases · Issue #3749 · backdrop/backdrop-issues

I worked on that: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3134/ but I hit a difficulty that I dont recall and put it down for a while. Something catch-22-ish that I couldnt get around; dont recall what it was. Also didnt really like the approach in that PR.

Issue #1602: Layout path wildcards by docwilmot · Pull Request #3134 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop/backdrop-issues#1602

Maybe we should support both % and *? Possible reasons to do so in a comment to Issue 1602.
